meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Liz Tracey Robert Yowell Sara Wilkinson Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6000.

td.p: Liz Tracey, an insurance analyst from Lakewood, Ohio
Robert Yowell, an instructor of political science originally from Orange, California
Sara Wilkinson, a country club concierge from Athens, Georgia (whose 2-day cash winnings total $45,001)

tr.td: 1960s POLITICAL QUOTES
CABLE CHANNELS
HOW DO YOU LIKE MY DUDS?
(Alex: We want you to name the country. We'll give you the...)
PROVINCES
4-LETTER WORDS
(Alex: And in honor of our 6,000th Jeopardy! program, a whole category based on that number...)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Concerning the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis, this Soviet leader said that "Human reason won. Mankind won"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Concerning the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis, this Soviet leader said that "Human reason won. Mankind won"

tr.td: Sara
Robert
Liz

ZOOS
DE METER
A POLLO

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Sara
Robert
Liz

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: You had to think of the modern Olympics and the first Modern Olympics and the year in which they were held, and that would have led you--we hope--to a correct response.)
...
(Alex: [To Robert] Who was [*]? Elected in 1896. You\'re right.)
...
(Alex: [To Liz] You remembered the Baron de Coubertin? I guess you did.)
RobertWho was McKinley
$4,000
LizWho was McKinley?
$10,000
SaraWho is McKinley
$7,300
McKinley')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'He was the first U.S. president to be elected in an Olympic year')

tr.td: U.S. PRESIDENTS
He was the first U.S. president to be elected in an Olympic year
Sara
Robert
Liz
3-day champion: $72,701
3rd place: $1,000
2nd place: $2,000
Sara
Robert
Liz

14 R,
2 W
(including 1 DD)

18 R
(including 2 DDs),
2 W
